result.execSummary:
The defendant Latinia Gurley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Sentencing proceeded. Statements by State, Defense counsel and Defendant.

COURT ORDERED 
						
The court sentenced the defendant to 9 months in the House of Correction, concurrent to 15CM3473, with credit for 17 days time served. Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 18 months.  

If revoked Huber privileges under Sec.303.08 Wis. Stats. to apply towards Work, Treatment and schooling.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION 
90 Days of Condition time, with good time and with Huber for Work, Treatment and schooling to be used at the discretion of the probation agent

Defendant Latinia Gurley in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Defendant Latinia Gurley in custody.  Thaddeus P McGuire appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KKO  
Case in court for Plea Hearing/Sentencing hearing. Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.

Plea hearing held

AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant changes her plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to her plea, advised of her Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Defendant advised that if she is not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived her rights. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 

Documents received and filed.
Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum and Jury Instructions
received and filed.

Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.  Defendant to have no contact with ANY Walmart.  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 SUPERVISION.  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT.  Projected guilty plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 2, 2018 at 08:30 am.
